It can affect your skin, nose, mouth and eyes. Your face may turn red, swell, burn or feel like you're on fire. Rosacea skincare can be tricky and even overwhelming for some, but understanding your condition will not only make it easier to care for but can help identify the triggers that are causing flare-ups.

For many people who have Rosacea, the trick to managing it is understanding the condition. That's why we are here! Our articles are backed up by scientific research and will help you find your ultimate rosacea skincare routine. Learning how to care for Rosacea properly can help you manage this disease, making it easier to navigate through life.

It is important to note that the information about Rosacea found in this article is supported by scientific research at NCBI.

Understanding How to Care for Rosacea Skin
The first step in managing your Rosacea is to understand what causes it. The exact cause of Rosacea is still unknown, but it is thought to be genetically mediated. People with Rosacea have higher levels of abnormally processed cathelicidins- these are inflammatory mediators that are part of the skin's defense system.

Those who suffer from Rosacea often experience episodes of flushing, burning, stinging or itching in the same area where their rash is located. Similar to acne, this condition can lead to small bumps and pimples on your face. However, it is important to know that these two conditions have some differences.

Acne rosacea skincare can be very confusing because both conditions form when pores become clogged with oil and dead skin cells; however, unlike acne, Rosacea occurs when capillaries become enlarged and dilated due to increased blood flow. This leads to redness in the skin which can be blushing or flushing on your cheeks or forehead.
